main event: A civilian witness observed a bright, circular object hovering above the trees near the River Thames in Surrey, England in June 1951.
interesting points: The object stayed in one position for several minutes before disappearing.
The witness went to get binoculars or a camera but was unable to observe the object again.
The witness described the object as being the size of an average meteor, with a definite line on the lower part.
The witness initially thought it might be a balloon or airplane, but determined it was not a known type of aircraft.
The witness scanned the sky but did not see the object reappear.
